page.title: 07FARMING IN EGLOSKERRY (2).
page.content: {Silage and hay. There are 2329 acres of grass grown, well over three quarters of the total acreage.The grass is stored for use as silage or hay.Silage is used for food,and hay is used for food and bedding. There are fifteen farmers who make silage.The amount made ranges from 500 tons to 2000 tons. Some farmers measured the amount of silage in acres.This ranged from 16 acres to 155 acres.Fourteen farmers keep their silage in pits.Two farmers use the big bale method of storage.Seven farmers use both methods. Eleven of the seventeen farmers grow hay.Hay is measured in tons,acres or bales.The most grown in bales is 1200 and the most grown in acres is 85 acres and the most grown in tons is 50 tons.More people make silage than hay.
